name: Hilton Rome Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first stay in Hilton. I expected more from such a prestige brand. Room very small, furnishing ok. Shuttle bus to city center couple times a day - very good idea. Free of charge of corse. I can recommend this hotel to business travelers.
reviews.title: Not bad, bud I expected more.

reviews.text: Stayed one night at the Hilton Rome airport before flying out the next morning. It is a nice business hotel with convenient access to all terminals at the Rome airport. Rooms are pretty basic but comfortable. Staff is friendly. Not much more to add - it is your basic 3 to 4 star airport hotel.
reviews.title: Nice spot for an early morning flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Frankly, we chose this hotel because we could pay for it with our AAdvantage miles and because it was close the the airport. Our experience started a bit rough: By the time we reached Rome, it was after 10PM and they apparently lock all the airport doors at 10PM -- except one, and that one door doesn't easily connect to the tube-like walkway to the Hilton. If it weren't for a repeat Rome arriving person who was also going to the Hilton, we might still be wandering around the airport trying to find our way to the hotel ... (we were probably jet lagged, too). Anyway, we finally found the walkway to the hotel and checked in --all good. We got to our room and there was no electricity. We tried all the switches we can feel for, thinking this was some Italian hotel "thing," but we finally had to call the desk and get help. Someone eventually fixed the problem (by then, I was out cold in the dark on a lounge chair) and the lights came on. From that point on, all was fine. We loved the free shuttle into downtown Rome, we loved the walking access to the airport AND the rental car agent. The breakfast was good (certainly not free, but good) and the staff were all friendly. We've already decided that our next trip to Italy will include an overnight here.
reviews.title: Great convenience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this property the day before we were to fly home after a fantactic stay in Sorrento. Checking in was slightly delayed because the hotel claimed that they did not have our reservation even though I was holding documents with a confirmation number. After disappearing for about 15 minutes the clerk came back and gave us our room. The room was clean and of decent size. The shower was great. The property could use some refreshing but overall it is fine for an overnight stay before flying home. The breakfast buffett is quite good and very large. There is definitely something for everyone. This hotel is average and probably below average when compared to other airport located Hiltons. I would have no problem staying here again before flying home. I did like the presence of security. They made sure only guests used the elevators.
reviews.title: A decent place to stay before flying home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on July 5th and then on July 18th and both times in the same room.
reviews.title: The first stay was better than the second

reviews.text: my wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton Rome Airport Hotel on two occasions recently, and we were not disappointed. We booked rooms on the Executive Floor which affords access to the Executive Lounge where you can get snacks and/or drinks during the day and in the evening which is a major plus after a long overnight flight from the US.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are comfortable and clean as well as very quiet in spite of the proximity to FCO. The walk to and from FCO is quite a distance but it is on the elevated walkways for most of the way. I would highly recommend this hotel for both business in leisure travelers who need accommodations close to FCO. Also, the buffet breakfast is excellent with many food options.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel twice on our trip to Rome.
reviews.title: Best way to leave Rome
A great way to end a trip to Rome
reviews.text: First, when we landed close to midnight (did not really want to go to the city at that time) and secondly when we flew out (flying around 6.00 in the morning is a great carrot to pick a hotel like this at the airport)
However, still a decent walk from the terminal, though an indoor walk. When it comes to that, guess nothing beats the Copenhagen Airport Hilton.
reviews.title: Great Place to rest day before flight

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night having flown into Rome airport arriving late. I booked the hotel via BA Holidays as their rate was better and included the full breakfast. The Hotel is linked to the airport so you can walk there and was what you would expect from a Hilton hotel, spacious clean modern rooms, with a sofa bed for my daughter. After a good nights sleep, we headed down for the full breakfast which was excellent, there was a huge range of food which would suit anyone, and any nationality. Service was good, efficient and with a smile. (it is also worth noting the hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service into Rome and Back if you just have a short stay it is ideal for getting a few hours in Rome on Business or to do the tourist bit!).
reviews.title: Convinient Quality Airport Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all an efficient quality Airport Hotel, which I will be using again in the future when arriving /. Departing Rome.
reviews.title: Not What you Expect from Hilton

reviews.text: If you are travelling very early from Fiumicino Airport then you have little option but to stay here as there are no other options in the immediate vicinity. Accordingly on this basis we booked one night following a stay in Rome. We did get a very good deal based on their normal prices by booking well in advance and paying in advance on a no cancellation basis. However, although we paid a lower than normal price we still expected to get treated as though we were welcome guests and not cash cows.
reviews.title: Nice and close to the airport

reviews.text: It started by having to queue to check-in at about 2.30pm on Saturday afternoon (The only time we had to wait to check-in at any hotel during a 3 week holiday in Italy and Croatia). We were hot and tired but nobody bothered to point out the cold water available on the other side of reception. It then took ages to actually check in while details of our passports were dutifully transcribed - much easier elsewhere. When we were eventually given the key to our room we found our room and at first sight it seemed very nice. It was clean, modern and well appointed.
reviews.title: Always a very good experience for us

reviews.text: However, then the problems started to occur. We had chosen to stay there because we wanted an early night prior to our very early start in the morning. However, there were 2 curtains. One had blackout lining - the other had no lining. As a result it was impossible to shut out the light sufficiently to allow us to sleep before it went dark outside, so it failed the first of the basics. We went to use the room safe. Both my wife and I tried to use it by following the instructions explicitly. Neither of us could make it work and indeed we could not get a display on the screen. We assume that there was an electrical fault.
reviews.title: Very glad this was our choice

reviews.text: Polite but bored staff, nice big rooms, average airport hotel. Clean and bland but nothing to worry about really. My real issue was with the pool area which was very poorly maintained, rusty metal, grumpy staff, not very clean. You had to pay to use sauna? even as hotel guest. We felt we were annoying the pool/ gym staff by being there. Rolled eyes several times when we asked taxing questions like where the changing room was etc..
reviews.title: Very average.

reviews.text: We (family of three) stayed at this hotel at the end of our 16 day trip to Italy before catching an early morning flight. We arrived via the Leonardo Express (after arriving at Roma Termini from Venice). The train station and the Hilton are connected by an enclosed walkway but be aware that the walk is very long, especially dragging bags. We weren't bothered by the walk and there are moving walkways to help, but if you have mobility issues, you need to know that the walk might be challenging. Our checkin was swift and our room (stayed using HHonors points) was prepared as requested. The climate control was good and the room of good size. We had not eaten since breakfast so grabbed a bite at the hotel restaurant. It was very pricey but the wait staff were pleasant and the food tasty. We were disappointed by the level of noise heard in the room. We were on the first floor and weren't sure whether it was from an adjacent room or a hotel lounge, but we were able to hear fairly loud music until about 11pm. Since we had a very early flight, this was a bit of an issue. The bathroom was good sized but the tub did not drain well. Standing in ankle-deep water during a shower is never fun. The beds and bedding were fine. This is a very convenient choice for an early flight but I would think twice about using it as an option for exploring Rome. It's too far out to allow easy access and there are many options in Rome itself.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: We had an early morning flight and this hotel was ideally situated so we could just walk to Alitalia in the morning. It was also very close to the rental car return garage and so it was easy to return our Avis Rental Car the night before our flight. Note: Gas stations near the airport close early...7 p.m. The rooms were nice and clean. Breakfast starts at 5:30 a.m. for those with early flights and has a large breakfast buffet with a nice assortment of food.
reviews.title: Hilton Rome Airport - good stay/convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were a bit on the pricey side but we loved the convenience of the location...we saved a little by booking a non-refundable rate. I agree that for the price wi-fi should be included in the price.
reviews.title: Very disappointed!

reviews.text: First of all my husband travels quite frequently & so we were using points from his Gold membership to stay in this hotel the night before flying out of Rome. First I'll say what I liked about the hotel. I liked that it was within walking distance to the airport to make our early morning flight. I also liked the pool, fitness center & the outdoor area for a relaxing sunbathing day before the long travel home. What I didn't like. The price of the hotel is very expensive so you would expect exceptional customer service. WRONG! It was by far the worst customer service I had during my 17 days of travel in Italy. The check-in wait was long & we were asked two separate times to switch lines because other more demanding platinum customers were in need of assitance. Talk about feeling SECOND CLASS! The staff in the fitness center were very rude to my husband when he attempted to wear flip-flops into the pool area a lady very meanly scolded him & demanded we wear hair nets. When inquiring about Wi-Fi we were told there would be a charge even though it was my understanding when booking the hotel that as a Gold member you could get a password for free internet. Then I waited in line in the lobby to see the concierge as sign instructed for a password to use the lobby computer for a considerable while, again having to waiting lines only to find out that even the hotel lobby computer was a pay per use computer. The restaurant was WAY over-priced as was the bar. I didn't encounter a single helpful or friendly staff person until we checked out which by that time was too late to change my opinion of this place. You're paying for the name & the location adjoining the airport but don't expect good service!
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we ended up staying here after we last minute bolted from our prior hotel in Fiumicino. We had booked the Best Western, but felt unsafe in that neighborhood and our room smelled bad and the hotel was empty. As we were taking back our rental car, we spotted the Hilton. It is definitely pricey, but at that moment was worth it. Great bar/restaurant area. The most comfortable beds! Decent food at the restaurant, but nothing like the small local restaurants throughout Italy.
reviews.title: heaven after our initial hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel at the end of October after a visit to Rome, Lucca, San Gimignano and surrounding areas, and Florence. We were on our way out on a flight from Fiumicino (or so we thought). I chose this place because I had points and was able to book this room for very little money and because it was close to the airport. It fulfilled its closeness--it is right at the airport--we took the Leonardo Express train from Rome and just followed the signs from the train station to the hotel. It was about a 10 minute walk with many moving sidewalks to speed you along the way. Despite a long line at the reception desk, we were quickly checked in and were given a big room in one of the corridors radiating off the central core where the elevators were located. It was a king room and it was clean, had a comfortable bed, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, and very nice bath amenities. We quickly freshened up and headed downstairs for dinner. It was very busy in the restaurant and were told we would have a long wait so settled in at the very nice bar with a glass of wine and beer. After only about 10 minutes we were seated. Our server was prompt and professional. Since we were at the Hilton we decided to have our first burger of the entire trip (a little homesick I guess) and it was good. I also had the soup--can't remember if it was pasta fagioli or minestrone but that wasn't quite as good. The prices were fairly high but kind of to be expected since it is the only place around to eat (I guess you could go over the airport and eat if you want to). We had a great night's sleep and were able to print out our boarding passes at a computer set aside for this purpose. We ate breakfast at the hotel which was a buffet and was fine (if again pricey). Since we were flying to the U.S. our terminal at the airport was 5 and this is not near the hotel but they provide an excellent shuttle service which quickly got us to the terminal. This should have been the end of the story...but it wasn't. After sitting on the tarmac for about 2 hours US Airways cancelled our flight due to mechanical issues (no weather radar working) and wouldn't you know it--we were sent to the Hilton again! The fact that we had stayed there the night before caused some confusion--they had our information on file and this messed things up somewhat. However, even with all of the people from the flight waiting in line it only took about 10 minutes to check in. Again the room was comfortable although not quite as nice--a queen bed, smaller, not as nicely decorated. The Hilton had one other flight in the same predicament and they set up a buffet in one of the conference rooms for lunch, dinner, and breakfast--not up to the quality of the restaurant but not bad either and I'm pretty fussy. We weren't allowed to take the shuttle in the morning until a certain time so we walked over to terminal 2 or 3 and took a shuttle from there to terminal 5 and it was a good thing because there was some difficulty with printing out our boarding passes. So all in all, it is a bit expensive but clean, efficient, and convenient to the airport. We found a charge for the second night on our credit card when we got back home (due to the confusion of the previous night's stay I'm sure) but before my husband even had time to challenge it it had been removed.
reviews.title: Quiet room at the airport

reviews.text: Just a long walk from the airport so very convenient if you are flying in or out of Rome. Rooms were nice. Hotel was very clean and the breakfast was incredible. Make sure it is included in your room.
reviews.title: Great breakfast

reviews.text: On a recent trip to Rome, I chose to stay at this hotel because I had stayed there four (4) years ago. At that time, the hotel was clean, convenient and offered a free shuttle bus to downtown Rome. Unfortunately, during my most recent stay, only two (2) out of three (3) of the previous advantages still existed. The hotel is convenient if you are flying in/out of Rome's Fiumicino, Leonardo da Vinci Airport. You can walk the approximate 10 minutes to the hotel via the enclosed walkways. At the end of the walkway before entering the hotel, definitely take the elevator to the ground level. It may be a bit of a wait for the elevator, but unless you want to be overwhelmed with the smell of urine, stay out of the stairwell leading to the ground level. There is no reason for anyone to use the elevator or stairwell unless they are going to the hotel as there is nothing else near the end of the walkway. Therefore, it is rather curious that the hotel does not clean the stairwell and at least try to eliminate or cover-up the retched urine odor in the stairwell. The second remaining positive for the hotel is the free shuttle bus back and forth to the city center. The bus runs every other hour in each direction. We used the bus to go to the city center for sightseeing and for evening transportation to have dinner in the city. The bus trip is approximately 40 minutes. Unfortunately, the quality of the hotel has definitely dropped off and it is questionable whether the convenient location and the free shuttle bus balance out a merely average hotel. The price per night is not inexpensive and careful consideration must be made before deciding on this hotel. Restaurant quality is average, but the prices for the meals are quite high. I am a Diamond member of Hilton's frequent guest program. I did appreciate the room upgrade, but the Executive Lounge was below par when compared with other Hilton hotels throughout Europe. Overall, just an average hotel.
reviews.title: Good Location, but Definitely Lacking

reviews.text: We (2 parents and 2 kids) had a 10 hour connection in Rome and wanted to be able to get some rest. We paid a little more than for other hotels near the airport (not much more) and it was worth it. It's a five minute walk from the terminal to the hotel, all indoors. Room was nice, nothing extraordinary. Room service was fast, yummy and reasonably priced for a luxury hotel. We asked for a late check-out for our day-use, and were granted it without questions.
reviews.title: Good solution for long connection
Stay here for the location
reviews.text: I stayed at this Hilton in Mid September. The prime reason for staying here is the fact that you can walk through the parking garage to the airport (10 min walk) . This is an obvious advantage for an early flight. The hotel is modern and I found the rooms to be clean and adequate in size. The staff was very friendly. The only negatives were minimal: the health club, looked nice but closed early, there was no doorman to assist in getting a cab ( the front desk gladly called one), Cab fare to downtown was approximately 40 euro. The “pros” include : proximity to the airport, the price was reasonable (185 euro with no advanced reservation), and the staff’s care in making sure you get up in time ( if you don’t answer your phone – they will come up and knock on the door).

reviews.title: would stay again
reviews.text: If you don't have an early flight - stay in Rome. If you do, arrive after dinner and enjoy the piece of mind of knowing you will make your flight without a problem.

reviews.title: Very convenient and it worked out great
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel during 2003. The hotel was a short walk from the Arrival areas of the airport. Grab a cart, load your suitcase(s) and walk to the hotel. The airport has many shops for food / newspapers / gifts - even a chapel.

I was arriving really late into Rome and an Italian friend suggested that, as a solo traveler, I make my one night hotel in Rome as close to the airport as possible. The Hilton is exactly that. But at a real premium...expensive. As it was late when I arrived, there wasn't anyone around in the airport...the luggage claim was dark, and like the bowels of a really bad Turkish bus terminal. I set off following less than adequate signage to the hotel. The signage is an H I believe. You walk for about 10 minutes through a pedway that connects the trains, terminals and car parks. If not for one other couple headed for the hotel, it might have been really an uncomfortable experience.
reviews.title: Hmmmmm Hilton Rome

reviews.text: The Hotel is an airport hotel. Nothing more to say other than you pay for the convenience of proximity to the airport. I returned to the hotel on the day before my departure as well. The other convenience is that the hotel pedway is connected to the train system.
reviews.title: Convenient w/ free shuttle service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean, a good place to sleep and go from. The breakfast was included in my booking... It was great. You can ask for an espresso rather than the American coffee that was totally tasteless. The free shuttle into Rome allowed for me to arrive by train, register and drop off my luggage, hop the shuttle and do some exploration...and eating in Rome. Loved the shuttle. The evening restaurant wait staff were terrible when it came to serving singles...we watched groups and couples be served and leave before they brought our meals. And the meal was terrible.....it shouldn't be at that price but it was awful.
reviews.title: Much Better Than Expected

reviews.text: This hotel is convenient for traveling, you pay for that convenience.
reviews.title: This is a convenience hotel

reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel located directly across from the airport (a 5 min walk). We stayed here the night before an early flight home and we're glad we did. It took a lot of stress out of trying to get to the airport and they offer a free shuttle that drops you off. They also offer a free shuttle into downtown Rome, but it only leaves the hotel every couple of hours so find out the schedule as soon as you arrive. Make sure that if you want breakfast in the morning to sign up for it when you book the hotel to get a discount, otherwise it will be around 25 EU/person. The rooms are very nice and the hotel over all is clean with a helpful staff. If you're willing to pay the $200/night for convenience, then I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Best in Rome

reviews.text: This hotel feels like it really is only just on the airport perimeter. I’d say it’s further away than the Novotel at Bangkok Airport, and that hotel has a shuttle bus from the Terminal! So be prepared for a fair trek along covered walkways, past the airport car parks and the train station.
reviews.title: Anonymous on-airport hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is fine - what you would expect from a modern airport Hilton. I had a club room which was nicely furnished, commendably quiet and surprisingly spacious. The only thing that struck me was the improbably small television, which was located diagonally opposite the obligatory easy chair. This meant that it was about as far away as could it be from where you would want to sit and watch it. Combine that with its tiny size and I’d say you’d need opera glasses to watch a programme. Sitting on the bed is the only solution.
reviews.title: Perfect for early flights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has the usual bar and open restaurant combination. The service in the bar was rather uncaring and somewhat unreliable. It took two orders to get a drink because the first order seemingly vanished into the ether.
reviews.title: FREE SHUTTLE TO ROME!!! LISTEN TO THIS REVIEW

reviews.text: The restaurant was completely full when we tried to eat, so we ended up feeding off the bar menu. And it seemed to me that the sliced chicken on the Cesar Salad came right out of a packet (but I’ll happily stand corrected if I’m offending the chef!). So if you want dinner, then it’s well worth making a reservation when you arrive at the hotel. Even though we didn’t eat in the restaurant , the food look interesting.
reviews.title: Convenient and worthwhile

reviews.text: There is a club lounge. I only arrived on the tail end of the cocktail ‘hour’ so they were clearing away the wine and the food. The wine was a bit disappointing and my colleague had to drink his from a tumbler because the staff couldn’t find another wine glass! All in all, I felt the focus was less on the guests than making sure no one got anything after 8pm!
reviews.title: Hesitated because of poor reviews, but our stay was great!

reviews.text: Drove to this hotel from Umbria. Easy to find and very convenient to all terminals. You need to take the free, frequent shuttle to Terminal 5 but can walk to the others. Hotel is full service and if you get upgraded to Executive floor it offers free breakfast and light dinner and drinks from 6-8 PM. Snacks available at other times.
reviews.title: Very convenient.
Overall satisfied
reviews.text: Rooms and bathrooms well sized. Beds comfortable. Perfect location for flights out of Rome.

Good hotel for the transit or over-nighting passenger. Good, clean, safe rooms. Staff helpful. Excellent location (10 minutes walk from Terminal). I had an over-night stay with my family and found the hotel very convenient.
reviews.title: A room with no view ...but close to the sea !

reviews.text: What do you expect from an airport hotel ? You are there for the convenience and once you have negotiated the rather bewildering walkways through the car parks the actual hotel is pretty OK . The rooms are clean , comfortable beds , enough room in the bathroom , no undue noise and the bar area is surprisingly " buzzy" ( good bar staff) Yes , the gym and pool need upgrading , yes the food is average by Italian standards and yes if you check in or out be prepared for a queue and staff who seem unsympathetic to your need to get going , but with so many transit "one day" customers it is understandable ( maybe not excusable !!)
reviews.title: Expensive Hotel

reviews.text: Very near some great beaches and Lidos !!
reviews.title: Close to Airport-Nice Hotel for Business & Families

reviews.text: I was traveling with my grown son and we chose the Hilton Rome Airport because we had very early flights the next morning. We stayed the evening of December 23rd. I have been a Hilton Silver Honors member for several years so I am very familiar with the brand.
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff, Room Average

reviews.text: The check in lady was very kind and helpful and she helped us with information about the hotel, the access via the walkway to the Airport terminal, the shuttle, etc.
reviews.title: great location for early flights!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice desk staff helped us with boarding passes.
reviews.title: Overnight Stay for Flight Next Day

reviews.text: We stayed in a room on the 3rd floor - the pros were:
reviews.title: Convenient airport hotel

reviews.text: the room was clean, the bed sheets were clean and the bathroom was sufficient, it also had a nice television (we did not use because we saw that it was 22 Euro charge), also a nice tea kettle.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
Very convenient
reviews.text: For an airport hotel this was very nice. We stayed overnight whilst awaiting our plane home. Our flight didn't leave until 4:30pm the next day and had no trouble negotiating a 2:00pm (free) checkout. Very quiet for an airport hotel and we had a good sleep. After checking out airport restaurants we decided to get room service and my very picky husband announced "the best hamburger I've ever had". The only complaint was the 20 euro wifi fee which always annoys me. Overall a very enjoyable stay.
It takes 10mins from Fiumicino T3.
reviews.title: Good location~!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Executive lounge was good~
reviews.title: Stay only for the location & shuttle bus

reviews.text: Happy hour until 8:30pm
reviews.title: Close, clean and comfortable!

reviews.text: Hot meals(Baked olive, Ham&cheese) , Wine, Whisky are
reviews.title: Quiet, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night between our flights. Inside the terminal we had a hard time finding the sign to locate the hotel but eventually we found it.
reviews.title: Good place to stay between flights

reviews.text: Check in was great and everyone that worked in reception was friendly. We ate dinner in the restaurant. It was decent for a night that was too late to travel to a restaurant and the staff was again great. The room was nice and the bed was relatively comfortable and large.
reviews.title: Bad toilets but acceptable if you have to crash for a night before

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One strange thing, we had an early flight the next day and left at around 5 AM - on the walk way back into the airport there were numerous people sleeping in that enclosed walkway between the Hilton to the airport - and from the smell of it, they were using it as a restroom. It was a little frightening to see first thing in the morning and a little hard to keep down your breakfast. Not the Hilton's fault - probably the airport's fault but it's the walkway to the Hilton so some airfresheners or open windows at least would help and not having to manuever your luggage around bodies on the ground.
reviews.title: Happy we chose to stay here

reviews.text: Overall a solid experience and a good night's sleep. As for all airport Hiltons, it would be nice to offer complimentary wi fi to your guests.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a night before catching an early morning flight back home. The best part of the hotel is the location because it is connected to the terminal. The pool and gym were really good and the breakfast was also really nice.. One thing that turned all of us off was the quality of the toilet and showers. It was a really bad that the shower curtains did not reach the floor (was atleast a foot above) and after the first of us finished our shower the bathroom was flooded. We complained on the Hilton website and they did apologise. This hotel is desperately in need of renovation and new furniture.
reviews.title: Expensively average and be prepared to pay for extras

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Rome Airport May 8-12 2005 and thoroughly enjoyed it. Clean, spacious room and since we're Hilton HHonors members stayed on the executive floor. Free shuttle running into the city leaves the hotel every even hour ( 8,10,12,etc ) and leaves downtown every odd hour ( 9,11,etc ).
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: I had actually thought "no, should not stay in an American hotel in Rome" before I got there, and then nicely surprized when I got there. It is actually very nice hotel, conveniently located at the airport, you can walk right to it using the moving sidewalks.
reviews.title: Nice and Cozy

reviews.text: Nicely organized, clean, lots of amenities, bar, restaurant, breakfast.
reviews.title: Bad customer experience and attitudes

reviews.text: They had shuttle services starting at 8am ending at 11pm, daily to Rome downtown, dropping you at the Piazza Venizia. Impossible to get lost in this magnificent city, even if you are not speaking any Italian.
reviews.title: Was Perfect for our Needs
Convenient but don't eat here
reviews.text: Hotel workers were all curteous, all spoke English with slight Italian accent, answered questions, made recommendations. At the bar, got a Coke Light at 5.50 Euro, ( minibar in the room was 4.50 euro) while waiting for the shuttle to city centre. When I asked the desk if I should catch a taxi, they suggested I save the 50 Euros by take their free shuttle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have Hilton gold status and it really paid off at this hotel. Nice lounge with free food and drinks including mixed drinks and bottled beer.Gold status also includes free internet and a wonderful breakfast spread. After breakfast (checked in online the night before ) an easy walkway back to the airport for our morning flight for an relaxing no stress morning to our gate to continue on to Portugal
reviews.title: We had a great stay!

reviews.text: Kinda spendy. Easy walk to terminal. Shuttle downtown and back, but check schedule as it seems to change.
reviews.title: Great for early morning flight

reviews.text: I don't see any reason to stay here unless you have a pre 9 am flight out of room.
reviews.title: Sometimes you don't get what you pay for - This hotel is overpriced

reviews.text: The hotel is situated close to the Fiumicino Airport, which made it ideal for booking as a layover stop in Rome. I read the reviews, and based on the fact that the hotel had a shuttle into Rome, I figured the cost of the 2 rooms we had would be offset by the savings we would have by using the bus into and back from the city.
reviews.title: Maybe I should blame United Airlines instead?

reviews.text: The rooms were acceptable, but looked dated with respect to the Hiltons I've seen in the United States. The lobby and common areas on the first floor did match my expectations. Both of the phones in my room did not work, so I couldn't make calls to our other room, in order to talk to the spouse or kids about getting together. This could have been easily alleviated if we had rooms next door to each other (as I had requested in my reservation). Instead, the hotel placed us into rooms that were two rooms apart and across a hallway. Maybe the words 'Next to' or 'Adjacent' got lost in translation.
reviews.title: Luxury prices but an average hotel!
Comfortable night before flight
reviews.text: My thirteen-year-old son and I stayed at the Hilton the night before an early flight back to the states. Our twin-bedded room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. It cost 156 euro, booked online before the trip. We appreciated being able to walk directly from the hotel into the airport the morning of our flight. (I would not have wanted to get up early enough to take a cab to the airport from the historic center for a 6:30 am check-in.)
The hotel staff were professional, friendly, and helpful.
reviews.title: Perfect for an early flight

reviews.text: As other reviewers have noted, the restaurant prices are shockingly high. Check out the buffet offerings (evening buffet is 37 euro pp) before you commit. Neither of us saw many offerings that appealed to us so we ordered ala carte. Although we had planned to order continental breakfast in the room, we scrapped that plan after seeing that a continental breaksfast from room service was 25 euro per person.
reviews.title: Overpriced even for the convenience - January 18, 2005
horrible experience!
reviews.text: We had the large and clean pool completely to ourselves and greatly enjoyed a refreshing dip. Note that the pool is only open until 9 pm and that bathing caps are required (but that rule was not enforced when my son asked if he had to wear one). The fitness center also had exercise bikes.

I stayed at this hotel the night before an early flight back to the USA. The hotel more then met my expectations. Sure I have stayed at nicer hiltons, but this is an airport...what do you expect? Check-in was fast , easy and friendly. My room had a nice view of the airport and was average in size, but very comfortable. The hotel came with all the normal amenites a traveler should expect. I never ate in the hotels bar or rest, but I did order room service and it was good for price I paid. One word of caution about this hotel, they seem to be very stingy with billing. If you even move anything around in the mini-bar it will cost you. Also, I ordered a movie and 5 mins later wanted to cancel, because I was too tired ... they said I had to pay for it anyway. Seems a little tough, but oh well. But all in all the hotel had very friendly service and lived up to the Hilton name.
reviews.title: Perfect before an early flight.

reviews.text: I've never stayed at an airport hotel that was fantastic, with the exception of the Sheraton Amsterdam at Schipol International Airport. But, the Rome Hilton @ Fiumicino isn't bad at all. The rate was about 160 Euros, with breakfast and included all taxes.
reviews.title: Well, it does its job...

reviews.text: The room size was adequate. No perks though because I gave my original Club Room to my aunt to use so I got stuck with the typical guest room. The Club Room has a few more nice touches, nothing more.
reviews.title: adequate
Rome
reviews.text: The hotel had a Club Lounge on the 5th floor and offered some of the freshest figs i've ever eaten. I could have sat all night in the Lounge and ate them.

Although people are raving about the breakfast in the morning, i don't understand what for. Yes there is a great variety but it doesnt mean that the quality of food matches it. All in all, an adequate airport hotel with friendly staff.
reviews.title: Nice before flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at Rome airport with our baggage missing, so we were pretty flustered.
reviews.title: Excellent - A great place to unwind after a longhaul flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To get to the Hilton, you cross a walkway from the airport, right past the Car Hire offices, so it's totally hassle free. It's a fairly short walk, which was good because of the luggage problems.
reviews.title: Average And A Bit Sterile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd upgraded to executive level, and even though we were early, my wife got to relax in the executive lounge sipping champagne while I followed up on the baggage. The room was ready when I returned, even though it was still before the check-in time. The executive room was very large and had a walk-in wardrobe. After a nice hot steamy shower in the accommodating bathroom, we lay down on the soft pillow, and fell asleep immediately. We usually pay a bit extra for an efficient comfortable no-hassles hotel like this, and it lived up to our expectation. The bar and ambiance was wonderful, and the singer was good. In the morning, I tried out the gym and swimming pool. Again it all lived up to expectations. It was a busy hotel, but staff were very efficient and friendly. Oh, and it was totally quiet in the room - no airport or traffic noises.
reviews.title: Only just ok.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd recommend this hotel if you have a need to stay near the airport. It's a traditional airport Hilton hotel.... large, comfortable rooms, efficient check-in and check-out... but a bit sterile, especially for a city like Rome. We stayed one night, and I am downgrading it because of their shocking almost-$45 per night charge for Internet access -- that is beyond greedy, and simply unacceptable.
reviews.title: Large and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a number of positives we experienced: staff was helpful when we requested a room change to be able to open a window; the breakfast buffet was above average; and the gym was large for hotel standards. But this was about it. The room size and the ambience were mediocre and lacking character; the mattresses, pillows, and blankets were below medium quality; all in all it reminded us more of a motel than a hotel, but the rate - despite being a special - was pricey. Bottom line, ok if you (as we did) just arrive from late and need a place to crash.
reviews.title: Convenient for early departures

reviews.text: This hotel is very nice! Great location, the food in the restaurant is good, and the service is great. It's very close to the airport and very easy to find with public transportation (there is a stop for it on the public train) After living on a student's budget in Italy for four months, this hotel seemed like a mansion!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We probably stay in this hotel about five times a year. It's a fantastic option for when you have an early morning flight out of FCO as it's connected to the airport and you can walk right from the hotel into the terminal. The rooms are very comfortable, quiet, and a decent size with nice plush beds and pillows. Nice shower and bathroom as well.
reviews.title: Great option for those early morning flights!

reviews.text: Some of the hallways smell of smoke even if you request a non smoking room since some floors have a mix of smoking and non-smoking rooms. I always request a room on a non-smoking floor and there is no smoke smell. The breakfast selection is huge and was very good... we've only had it once because it was included in the room rate. The staff has always been friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: location, convenience, but you'll pay for it....

reviews.text: My one big complaint with this hotel is that the price for the internet is outrageous. There is no reason to have the price that high (22 EUR) when the prices for the hotel are already a little expensive. To me it's just taking advantage of people. Otherwise I would give the hotel 5 stars.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: Like almost everyone else, I stayed for one night after a business trip to Rome and an early flight to the US the next day.
reviews.title: Good location to FCO

reviews.text: As a gold VIP hilton honours member I am fully aware of the high standards of hilton across the world across all sub division brands within hilton family
reviews.title: Disaster at Rome airport hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel pre cruise. And was just amazed at total lack of brand standard of the hilton name
reviews.title: Convenience & a good room but thats it.....

reviews.text: Upgraded to club floors using points. Wished I had not bothered dirty corridors food over floor club lounge poorly kept. Rude staff. Plates and glasses on most tables left after guests leaving lounge
reviews.title: Hilton Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: B fast was a joke in main restaurant. Waiters who were so dirty they smelt and looked totally unclean. Food display poor and when I congratulated the restaurents manager on the worst brand standard hilton b fast I was laughed at even after asking him to look at the buffet and egg station where food was just a mess
reviews.title: Perfect pre-flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The garden in had better standard in Rome !!!
reviews.title: No bang for your buck..

reviews.text: We traveled to Rome from the USA to take a cruise. We planned an extra day on the front end and back end of the cruise in order to have additional time in Rome. After crunching all the numbers looking for the best value for our family of 4 we decided on this hotel.
reviews.title: would stay here again

reviews.text: Many of the hotels we investigated would have required us to have 2 rooms. We were able to get us all into one room at this hotel. (We learned this only by calling the hotel. The website did not seem to indicate this option). The other reasons this added up to be a good value: free breakfast, free shuttle back and forth into Rome, and no additional expense paying transfer fees back and forth from the airport to hotel - you can easily walk the distance between the airport and hotel. Also, the transfer fee to the ship was a little less money since we were being picked up at the airport (although our transfer agency - Avanti Destinations -just went ahead and picked us up at the hotel anyway for the lesser rate). Also, we booked a post cruise excursion of Rome through Royal Caribbean to include the Vatican and Colosseum/Forum that dropped us off at the airport at the end of the excursion...again no transfer fees = savings! After we checked back in at the hotel we rested and then got back on the shuttle into Rome to have dinner and do some additional sightseeing on our own. The shuttle ride is only about 30 minutes or so.
reviews.title: Very convenient hotel at Fiumicino Airport

reviews.text: This hotel worked perfectly in many ways. Our flight arrived in Europe mid-morning so after checking in and leaving our bags with the front desk we just went to the executive lounge (which is included with this room selection) and had refreshments and relaxed then off on the free shuttle to Rome! Our teenagers actually had a little nap on the sofas in the lounge.
reviews.title: Good Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The quiet room was remarkably large and very clean with great beds. The free breakfast in the dining room was outstanding with so many delicious things to choose from. The executive lounge offered a nice little selection of complimentary snacks and drinks including sodas, juices, beer and wine. The shuttle service back and forth to Rome was perfect, dropping off guests in an excellent area of central Rome within walking distance to many of the sites/attractions and metro. The shuttle is a good size and holds around 50? or so passengers. We were always able to get a seat but it did fill up once and some guests had to wait for the next one into the city. Just get in line a few minutes early and you wont have any problem getting on. By the way, we used the metro to get over to the Sistine Chapel since we knew that would not be included in our post cruise excursion. The metro was very straight forward and easy to use and we always felt safe.
reviews.title: Convenient location – Good Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ease of being so close to the airport on the day of departure back to the US was wonderful. We planned to make the brief walk to our gate from the hotel and to our surprise the hotel van drove us to our gate. We will stay here again when we return which is sure to happen since we threw coins into the Trevi Fountain! Ha!
reviews.title: convenient and comfortable but extras are expensive

description: Business-oriented Hotel located 1/2 km from Leonardo Da Vinci, Fiumcino Airport & train station.
